programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A ruffled Helen Roper takes a cafeteria job to teach husband Stanley a lesson, but returns a wreck from the experience.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen hires Stanley's friend, Joey, to haul out their furniture so she can redecorate. Her brother in law, Hubert, hears of Helen's plan and decides to buy some new furniture. Joey offers to sell his furniture for him and sells it to Stanley. When Helen sees he bought her sister's furniture she freaks out.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen really wants an electric organ but Stanley won't pay for one. Anne has an emergency and asks Helen to do her a favor by showing a buyer some property. An embarrassing situation may complicate things.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Jeffrey Brookes has a secret. His Uncle Bill is a free spirited "hobo" who has no interest in material things. To his horror, Bill shows up at his doorstep...but not before Stanley meets him and hires Bill to help around his place.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack seeks advice from a psychologist about his recent impotence. Vicky thinks Jack is cheating on her with E.Z.'s girlfriend Susie.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry suspects the London couple with whom Sara and Jackie swapped apartments are terrorists.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rushes' new piano gets stuck in the stairway just as Muriel goes into labor, leaving Henry and Monroe to devise a way to get her out of the second floor and to the hospital.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel's defense of Henry to her disapproving mother creates a rift which Henry has to heal.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry disowns Sara when she pursues a job on a talk show instead of her college degree.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: A Policeman's Wife is not a Happy One
programme.desc: Brad chooses a police street beat over a desk job, then calls off his wedding to spare Jackie the life of a cop's wife.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: After a week of Muriel's false labor pains, Henry reluctantly goes to a meeting with his boss, leaving Monroe in charge. First of two parts.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry gains a new son but loses his job when he misses his appointment with Wainwright to be with Muriel in the delivery room. Part 2 of 2

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry threatens to move out when Muriel's mother Iris comes to visit her new grandson and decides to stay.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: Who Was That Baby I Saw You With?
programme.desc: Muriel's photo session of babies with Cosmic Cow results in Andrew being taken by a slightly senile grandmother.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: It's contract negotiation time at Cobb's and after 12 years, Bannister feels he deserves a raise.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Although Edna wants the job herself, Bannister assigns Christian in charge of creating a store display.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Instead of spending the staff's money wisely, Bannister buys them a racehorse and enters it into a race the very next day.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Word of a new gold mine prompts Bannister to convince Edna to investigate their life savings.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Birthday girl Edna receives flowers from one of her high school sweethearts who want to see her again. Their reunion gets interrupted when a jealous Bannister shows up and learns they were actually married.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mr. Roper decides to fix Jenny up with Brookes' nephew and Brookes freaks out upon learning about it.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry ponders having a vasectomy to overcome his fear of impregnating Muriel again.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: To Buy or Not to Buy
programme.desc: A robbery in the house prompts Henry to order a shotgun for protection.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry is forced to stay with Iris when Andrew contracts chicken pox, an illness Henry thinks he has never had.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's ineptitude while hanging a portrait of Henry sends an angry Henry chasing after Monroe who then tumbles down the stairs.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: On Henry's advice, Monroe pursues a woman friend of Jackie's who turns out to be a man.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: Do You Take This Woman Again?
programme.desc: Henry and Muriel's decision to renew their wedding vows on their 26th anniversary puts their marriage on the rocks.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The family is worried when Iris, depressed about the coming holidays, fails to show up to help prepare the Thanksgiving dinner.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A visit from her ex-singing partner causes Muriel to wonder what her life would have been like if she had pursued her career.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry must undergo a rigorous physical examination to qualify for increased life insurance coverage.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: As a Mother's Day promotion, Edna's suggestion of providing free childcare in the store turns out to be a big success. Bannister is left with a small problem though. A child who refuses to speak, has been left behind. Since no child has been reported missing, they decide to keep the boy at the store until someone comes to get him.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Bannister discovers Viker has been kicked out of his house, and is now sleeping on the couch in his office. Bannister offers to let Viker stay with them.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard receives a chain letter and declines to continue despite the urging of his superstitious co-workers. Then accidents start to occur at Cobbs and Marlene heads to the hospital. Howard starts to rethink his actions.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: After an unpleasant encounter with mobster Meatloaf Rothko the police ask Howard to wear a wire and meet with Rothko. Reluctant, Howard's staff urges him to do it and be a hero.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: Only God Can Make a Tree
programme.desc: The city plans on removal of a stately old tree and Howard galvanized Cobbs employees to protest. Howard, Viker, Leslie, and Jake are thrown in jail and have to plead their case before a judge.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: At Susan's mother's funeral, Arthur, the father who abandoned the family earlier, turns up and takes such a dislike to Ben he offers his daughter a million pounds to divorce him.

programme.desc: Henry ponders having a vasectomy to overcome his fear of impregnating Muriel again.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry must undergo a rigorous physical examination to qualify for increased life insurance coverage.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley fears Helen accidentally gave a box containing his girlie magazines to a church rummage sale.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's luncheon makes her consider leaving the Cheviot Hills neighborhood. Stanley believes her and, without asking, has Jeffrey Brookes put their home on the market. Will The Ropers really relocate?

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: While teaching at his old cooking school, Jack finds himself in a stew when Dean Traver's voluptuous niece, Betty Jane, cooks up a seductive plan to win an "A".

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Accident-prone Cindy appears to have taken the ultimate misstep when she starts collecting maternity clothes, leading Jack to make an astonishingly funny marriage proposal.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A surprise visit by the battling Ropers turns into a romantic triangle when lusty Helen seeks solace from Jack and Janet and lands in the arms of Ralph Furley.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack poses as his own twin romance Ralph Furley's attractive visiting niece.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack gets a preview of the great hereafter when Larry hatches a plan to save him from his girl's murderously jealous other boyfriend.
